title: Public Housing Photos Show Scenes From An Earlier Chicago
teaser: We hear the story of urban photographer Patricia Evans. Back in the 1980s, after she was beaten and sexually assaulted near a Chicago public housing project, she chose not to run from her fears.
contentencoded:
We hear the story of urban photographer Patricia Evans. Back in the 1980s, after she was beaten and sexually assaulted near a Chicago public housing project, she chose not to run from her fears. Rather, she became a photographer of life in Public Housing. NPR recently featured some of Evans' work in an interactive photo essay.

Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
